sentence.idiomatic: This road is frequently jammed.
I'm going to be half an hour late. I'm in a traffic jam.
It's not rush hour, so there isn't any traffic jam.
There is nothing special about this design at all.
This skirt is really unique.
What is your restaurant's specialty?
Next time you pass by my house, you must come up and sit for a while.
When I passed by that shop, I saw there was a crowd of people in the doorway.
After studying for more than a month, your Chinese has gotten a lot better.
I heard that the mayor is coming to tour our factory this afternoon.
Tomorrow the tour guide will take us to tour the former Imperial Palace.
I just moved into a new house. When you have some time, come over for a tour.
I often go for foot massages, it feels so good.
Your wife gives you a massage every day--you're so lucky.
My shoulder is really sore. Could you massage it for me a bit?
Wow, there are so many cars!
Bangkok is known for its traffic jams.
Will we pass by the palace?
We should. Look at all the temples!
It's a Buddhist nation. We should go and take a look around.
OK, I also want to go on a boat.
Let's go at night.
After that we'll go and get a massage.
All right! What should we have for lunch? I'm starving.
I hear that the roadside restaurants are especially good.
Let's go find one.
